description:
Dear Doctors,

MAKING CHANGE IN YOUR CAREER PATH

A leading Medical Group with rapid expansion, listed on HKEX's Main Board (Stock code: 2138)

We are now recruiting doctors with different aspirations and inviting professional applicants for the following vacancies:

GENERAL PRACTITIONERS (FULL-TIME/ PART-TIME)

- Attractive Salary and Incentive Scheme

- Fresh graduate and experienced GPs are welcome

Please contact Julie Chow at 9328 9164 juliechow @umhgp.com & Tony Tsoi at 6655 6953 tonytsoi @umhgp.com for further details.
selling_points: Attractive Salary and Incentive Scheme
Fresh graduate
FULL-TIME/ PART-TIME

description:
Complete registration under the Medical Registration Ordinance of Hong Kong
 LMC or fresh grad will also be considered
 Excellent interpersonal and communication skill
 Working location: Central / Mongkok / Causeway Bay
 Sunday and Public holidays off, no night shift duty required 

We offer attractive remuneration.  Please send a detailed resume and expected salary to HR Dept, 2/F., Bonaventure House, 91 Leighton Road, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong.

Description
描述

At Aspire Dental Care, our employees come first. We believe that attracting, hiring, and nurturing the right people is what sets our clinic apart. You will be surrounded by team members that do the right thing, using sound judgment, even when no one is looking. We hire and retain individuals that consistently demonstrate warmth, care and courage to support and strengthen the team.

在 Aspire Dental Care，員工是第一位的。我們相信吸引、僱用和培訓合適人選是我們診所與眾不同的地方。您將會被一群即使沒有人注意，會用合理的判斷去做正確的事的團隊所包圍。我們聘用和留住態度誠懇、關懷團隊，並以勇氣支持我們團隊的員工。

Hygienists are responsible for ultrasonic/hand scaling (sickle, Gracey curettes) and polishing, deep scaling, root planing, x-ray taking, 3D scanning and reporting, oral hygiene instruction, dental/bleaching education, etc.

Qualifications
工作資格

Using your best judgement to do what is fair and right, even when it may not be in your immediate self-interest.
用你最好的判斷來處理公平正確的事情,即使這可能不符合你的直接利益
Highly aware of how your own behaviour impacts others and make them feel.
高度了解自己的行為如何影響他人並如何影響他們的感受
A keen eye for orderliness and cleanliness
對整齊和清潔非常敏銳
Empathy (feeling what others may be feeling).
有同情心 (能夠察覺到別人的感受)
A true desire to satisfy the needs of others in a fast paced environment (likes to do things FOR people as opposed to doing things TO people).
在快節奏的環境中,真正的渴望滿足別人的需求 (喜歡為別人做事而不是對別人做事)
Enjoys refining procedures (likes to make things run more efficiently).
喜歡精煉日常一般的步驟和過程 (喜歡讓事情更有效率)
Enjoys being accurate when going through procedures.
喜歡準確地進行程序
Multi-tasking and great organizational skills (likes to organize the house).
能同時處理多項任務和擁有良好的組織能力 (喜歡整理家居)

Pay
薪酬

$20,000+ per month. Pay is NOT based on seniority. It is based 51% on attitude and 49% on performance. Therefore your pay can be quickly increased in a matter of months to match your contributions to our Team.
每月$ 20,000+。薪酬不是基於資歷。它是基於:工作態度-51%, 工作表現-49%。因此, 您的工資可以在幾個月內快速增加, 以配合您對我們團隊的貢獻。

Details of the position:
職位詳情：

Work 1-5 days per week
每週工作1-5天
9.5 hour work shift
9.5小時輪班
12 days annual leave
12天年假
Birthday holiday
生日假期
Incentive bonus scheme
獎勵獎金計劃
Exclusive dental benefits
獨家牙科福利
Clean, spacious, modern and ergonomic working environment
清潔、寬敞、現代化並符合人體正確姿勢的工作環境
Hard working and aspiring teammates
勤奮和對工作有熱誠的隊友

Part-time hours: 9.5 - 47.5 per week

Description

Aspire Dental Care offers comprehensive dental services to help Hong Kong people keep their teeth for their lifetime, in proper health, comfort, function and aesthetics. We believe our promise, when delivered with gracious service and hospitality, helps create long-term, comprehensive change in the lives of our patients, our employees, and our community. 

At Aspire Dental Care, our employees come first. We believe that attracting, hiring, and nurturing the right people is what sets our clinic apart. You will be surrounded by team members that do the right thing, using sound judgment, even when no one is looking. We hire and retain individuals that consistently demonstrate warmth, care and courage to support and strengthen the team.




Qualifications

Using your best judgement to do what is fair and right, even when it may not be in your immediate self-interest.
Highly aware of how your own behaviour impacts others and make them feel.
A keen eye for orderliness and cleanliness
Empathy (feeling what others may be feeling).
A true desire to satisfy the needs of others in a fast paced environment (likes to do things FOR people as opposed to doing things TO people).

Details of the position:

Work 1-5 days per week
9.5 hour work shift
Birthday holiday
Incentive bonus scheme
Clean, spacious, modern and ergonomic working environment
Hard working and aspiring teammates
Visit www. aspiredentalcare.hk for more details.

company: Hong Kong Sheng Kung Hui Welfare Council Limited
description:
Establishedin 1966 and incorporated as a charitable organization in 2013, the Hong Kong Sheng Kung Hui Welfare Council (“the Council”) has been providing multi-faceted services to individuals across all ages and socioeconomic backgrounds in line with its service philosophy, “Personalised Service, Holistic Care”, to “Transform Lives” so they may be “Live in Abundance.For further information about the Welfare Council, please visit its website at http://www.skhwc.org.hk       

Compassionate and Quality Primary, Preventive Care & Rehabilitative Services

Being a pioneer in medical and social care integration, the primary, preventive care & rehabilitative services of the Welfare Council is providing services in primary and preventive care, occupational therapy, physiotherapy, nursing, counseling and other allied healthcare services. We now invite passionate and result driven to join us.

Requirements:


 A medical qualifications registrable in Hong Kong under Medical Registration Ordinance, Cap. 161.

 Responsibilities:

To provide on-site medical consultation and treatment, management of episodic illness and sub-acute problems of the Service Users in our clinic and residential elderly and rehabilitation homes;
Regular health assessment and medical examination of the Service Users, pre-employment and annual medical checkup of our staff;
Together with our allied paramedical staff to assess on the formulation of care plans having regard to the health conditions of the Service Users;
Advice on maintaining proper records of health conditions of the Service Users, including medication records;
Specialist referral  for further treatment
Execute the funding／government subsidy projects, such as colorectal cancer screening plan, vaccination plan, etc.
【Part-time／retired medical doctors are also welcomed, working hours are flexible.】

Remuneration packages will commensurate with qualifications and experiences. Interested parties please apply with full curriculum vitae with Expected Salary and Available Date to Human Resources Department, Hong Kong Sheng Kung Hui Welfare Council Limited, 5/F, Marina House, 68 Hing Man Street, Shaukeiwan, Hong Kong or e-mail to "Apply Now" .  Please indicate the reference number COW(KT)/MO/202112-2 on the front of the envelope. Application will be reviewed upon receiving until the post is filled.
All applications will be treated in strict confidence for the recruitment purpose only.  Candidates not invited for interview within 8 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful, and the application papers will be retained for a maximum period of 6 months.

Job Descriptions

Meeting with patients to discuss and treat dental concerns, performing regular cleanings and other preventative procedures, and establish a plan for better dental hygiene.
Performing dental procedures, such as extractions, root canals, and filling cavities.
Applying helpful agents to teeth, such as sealants or whiteners.
Prescribing medications for dental problems, such as pain medications or antibiotics.
Giving clients sedatives or anaesthesia prior to administering treatments.
Ordering diagnostic measures, such as x-rays, models, etc.
Using tools, such as drills, probes, brushes, or mirrors, to examine and treat teeth and mouth.
Keeping records relating to the oral health of patients and the treatments given to them.
Managing and communicating with other staff members to provide care to patients.

Job Requirements

Able to converse in English and Mandarin.
Have high level of patience and customer-care service.
Excellent in communication and active listening skills.
Meticulous, detailed and careful in his work.
BDS or equivalent qualifications recognized by the Malaysia Dental Council.
Possess aligned dental philosophy in minimally invasive and preventive dentistry with the best interest of patient and practice at heart (minimum 5 years of practicing experience will be an advantage)
Flexible with work schedule and able to work on 6 days of variable shifts
selling_points: Clear Aligners
Dentist
Dental Clinic

job_title: Post-doctoral Fellow in Youth Mental Health(509256)
description:
Applications are invited for appointment as Post-doctoral Fellow in Youth Mental Health in the Department of Psychiatry (Ref.: 509256), to commence as soon as possible for two to three years.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a multidisciplinary team based at the Department of Psychiatry. The team consists of enthusiastic and highly-motivated individuals, and is internationally renowned for its contribution towards clinical research in psychiatry and mental disorders.  Information about the team can be found at https://www.psychiatry.hku.hk/major.html.

Applicants should possess a doctoral degree by research (Ph.D. or equivalent) in psychiatry, psychology, social sciences, public health, sociology, statistics, or a relevant discipline, with an excellent publication track record. They should have a quantitative background, relevant experience in conducting and managing community research and clinical studies, and demonstrated expertise in conducting psychiatric interviews and analysing large and complex datasets.  Proficiency in at least one statistical software package (e.g. SPSS, Stata, SAS, R, Mplus) is required. 

The team is looking for an individual with high calibre to develop studies in the area of early intervention in mental disorders, in collaboration with expert researchers and clinicians. The appointee will conduct scholarly research, lead projects, prepare manuscripts and reports, assist in the supervision of junior research staff and students, and perform other duties as assigned. This position would be ideal for someone wanting to develop academically in the field of early intervention and youth mental health.  Those who have responded to the previous advertisement (Ref.: 508605) need not re-apply.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.

The University only accepts online applications for the above post.  Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V.    Review of applications will start as soon as possible and continue until February 12, 2022 or until the post is filled, whichever is earlier.

Advertised:Dec 15, 2021 (HK Time)
Applications close:Feb 12, 2022 (HK Time)

有意申請者請 按 APPLY NOW申請

job_title: Research Officer (holding the title of Project Manager) ( 508866)
description:
Applications are invited for appointment as Research Officer (holding the title of Project Manager) in the School of Public Health (Ref: 508866), to commence as soon as possible for two years, with the possibility of renewal subject to satisfactory performance.

Applicants should possess a Ph.D. degree with a strong background in public health, medical science or related disciplines. They should have relevant post-doctoral work experience in managing large-scale research projects. They should also have excellent written and oral communication skills, and the ability to work independently and in collaboration with a multidisciplinary team. Experience in running health-related research projects including multi-site international studies or community-based studies would be advantageous.

The appointee will oversee various component projects in the infectious disease epidemiology research group, and manage the operational, coordination and logistical aspects of a wide range of research processes and activities. He/She will coordinate participant enrolment in outreach centres and the community; ensure compliance with Good Clinical Practice and other regulatory requirements; liaise with site partners, funding agencies and international collaborators; draft reports; assist in chain management of clinical specimens and; assist in quality assurance of data, budget planning, grant administration, financial oversight and reporting; and perform other duties as assigned. 

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits. The appointment will attract a contract-end gratuity and University contribution to a retirement benefits scheme, totalling up to 15% of basic salary. Housing benefits will be provided as applicable.

The University only accepts online application for the above post. Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V.  Review of applications will start on November 30, 2021 and continue until March 31, 2022, or until the post is filled, whichever is earlier.

有意申請者請 按 APPLY NOW申請
selling_points: oversee various component projects
ensure compliance with Good Clinical Practice
assist in chain management of clinical specimens

Applicants should be a dental surgeon registered with the Dental Council of Hong Kong with at least 5 years’ post-registration experience.  They should possess a practicing certificate issued by the Dental Council of Hong Kong; be a member of Medical Protection Society; and possess an Irradiating Apparatus Licence.  They should have excellent communication skills in both English and Chinese; and be able to work independently with initiatives.  Demonstrated leadership and planning skills, as well as the ability to delegate effectively are required.

The appointee will provide dental services to students, staff and their dependents.  He/She will assist in the strategic planning and administration of the dental clinic. 

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.

Applications are invited for appointment as Consultant (Family Medicine and Primary Care) (2 posts) to be seconded to The University of Hong Kong (Shenzhen) Teaching Hospital Limited (THL) and assigned to work in the HKU-Shenzhen Hospital (Ref.: 503433), to commence as soon as possible, on a three-year fixed-term basis, with the possibility of renewal.

The University of Hong Kong (HKU) has been collaborating with Shenzhen Government to develop the HKU-Shenzhen Hospital as a teaching hospital of HKU. With the presence of HKU, a new operation model for the Hospital has been introduced, aiming at providing high-quality services from primary to tertiary levels to patients in the region, whilst sustaining a teaching and training mission well supported by a robust research component. The Hospital has commenced operation since October 2012. As the Hospital is located in Shenzhen, travelling to Mainland China is required.

Applicants should possess a medical degree registrable with the Medical Council of Hong Kong and a specialist qualification and experience in Family Medicine and Primary Care.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits. The appointment will attract a contract-end gratuity and University contribution to a retirement benefits scheme, totalling up to 15% of basic salary.

The University only accepts online application for the above posts. Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V.  Review of applications will commence as soon as possible and continue until the posts are filled.

Interested candidates, please click APPLY NOW  to apply.

Applications are invited for appointment as Post-doctoral Fellow (several posts) in the School of Public Health (Ref.: 509106), to commence as soon as possible for two years, with the possibility of renewal. 

Applicants should possess a Ph.D. degree in epidemiology, pharmacoepidemiology, or a related discipline, with a strong background in infectious disease epidemiology, surveillance and control. They should have excellent communication skills, experience in knowledge sharing, a strong record of research output, and the ability to work independently as well as in a multidisciplinary team. Relevant research experience in infectious disease epidemiology would be desirable. 

The appointees will work with a research team to study infections and immunity in the community, analyse large and complex datasets, and perform other duties as assigned. They will work semi-independently under the supervisor and mentorship of senior academic staff, and will have opportunities to present and publish their own research findings. Information about our COVID-19 research can be obtained at https://covid19.sph.hku.hk/.  Information about the School can be obtained at http://sph.hku.hk/.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.

The University only accepts online application for the above posts. Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V.  Review of applications will start on December 21, 2021, and continue until February 28, 2022, or until the posts are filled, whichever is earlier.

Advertised:Dec 7, 2021 (HK Time)
Applications close:Feb 28, 2022 (HK Time)

Applications are invited for appointment as Post-doctoral Fellow in the School of Chinese Medicine (Ref.: 508824), to commence as soon as possible for two years, with the possibility of renewal subject to satisfactory performance.

Applicants should possess a Ph.D. degree and proven experience in Molecular Pharmacology, Metabolomics, Chemical Biology and animal experiments.  They should be an outstanding and self-motivated researcher with proven research track record in international publications, with a good command of spoken and written English and Chinese, and the ability to work independently.  The appointee is expected to be involved in various related research projects.  He/She will join a multidisciplinary research group to conduct the studies on drug discovery and explore molecular mechanisms of Chinese Herbal Medicine for cancer and metabolism diseases.  The appointee will also carry out new drug development study, assist in laboratory research activities, and have the opportunity to collaborate with scientists from HKU, the Mainland China and North America.  Enquiries about the duties of the post can be sent to Dr. Jianping Chen at[via APPLY NOW] .  Applicants who have responded to the previous advertisement (Ref.: 504172) need not re-apply.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.

job_title: Tenure-Track Clinical Professor/Clinical Associate Professor in Haematology(509086)
description:
Applications are invited for appointment as Tenure-Track Clinical Professor/Clinical Associate Professor/Clinical Assistant Professor in Haematology in the Department of Pathology (Ref.: 509086), to commence as soon as possible, on a four-year fixed-term basis, with the possibility of renewal and consideration for tenure before the expiry of a second four-year fixed-term contract.

Applicants should possess a medical qualification registrable with the Hong Kong Medical Council, and a professional qualification in Pathology (HKCPath, MRCPath, FRCPA or equivalent, such as an American Board certification). They should have a solid track record of clinical services in all aspects of diagnostic haematology including phenotypic and genetic testing, and of medical research in basic, translational and molecular haematology, outstanding research achievement with evidence of international recognition and demonstrated leadership ability in teaching, curriculum development and research postgraduate education. The appointee will take part in clinical services, undergraduate and postgraduate teaching, supervision of postgraduate students, and academic research. He/She is also expected to perform administrative duties at the Departmental and Faculty level. Less experienced applicants may be considered for appointment as Clinical Associate Professor/Clinical Assistant Professor.  Information about the Department can be obtained at http://www.patho.hku.hk/. Enquiries about the duties of the post should be sent to [via APPLY NOW]

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.  At current rates, salaries tax does not exceed 15% of gross income.  The appointment will attract a contract-end gratuity and University contribution to a retirement benefits scheme, totalling up to 15% of basic salary.  A monthly cash allowance will be offered to the successful candidate.   Housing benefits will also be provided as applicable.

The University only accepts online application for the above post.  Applicants should apply online and provide a) an executive summary describing your most outstanding accomplishments and qualifications; b) a C.V. and a publication list highlighting your best papers; c) a 1-page description of your future research and career plan; and d) at least 3 reference letters.  Review of applications will start on January 1, 2022 and continue until June 30, 2022, or until the post is filled, whichever is earlier

description:
Applications are invited for appointment as Post-doctoral Fellow (several posts) in the Department of Microbiology (Ref.: 509202), to commence as soon as possible for one or two years, with the possibility of renewal subject to satisfactory performance.

These posts are created specifically to bring new impetus and talent to the University’s research enterprise, and to meet the strategic research needs identified by the Department of Microbiology. Applicants should have a Ph.D. degree with extensive research experience in cellular and molecular biology, cancer biology, immunology or virology; and preferably with basic laboratory skills of animal studies (mouse models).  The appointees will conduct research projects related to influenza virus, coronavirus, or Epstein-Barr virus under the supervision of Professor Honglin Chen. The appointee may work off-campus occasionally on collaboration projects with other academic institutions and companies. Please find more details for research projects under Professor Honglin Chen’s lead at https://hub.hku.hk/cris/rp/rp00383.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.

The University only accepts online application for the above posts.  Applicants should apply online, upload a cover letter and an up-to-date C.V.  Review of applications will start on December 27, 2021 and continue until February 15, 2022, or until the posts are filled, whichever is earlier.

Applicants should possess a Ph.D. degree or an equivalent qualification in Microbiology or a related discipline. Research experience in performing live virus infection would be an advantage. job_title: Post-doctoral Fellow in Digital Mental Health(509255)
description:
Applications are invited for appointment as Post-doctoral Fellow in Digital Mental Health in the Department of Psychiatry (Ref.: 509255), to commence as soon as possible for two to three years.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a multidisciplinary team based at the Department of Psychiatry. The team consists of enthusiastic and highly-motivated individuals, and is internationally renowned for its contribution towards clinical research in psychiatry and mental disorders. Information about the team can be found at https://www.psychiatry.hku.hk/major.html.

Applicants should possess a doctoral degree by research (Ph.D. or equivalent) in psychiatry, psychology, social sciences, public health, sociology, statistics, or a relevant discipline, with an excellent publication track record. They should have a strong quantitative background, relevant experience in conducting and managing community research and clinical studies, and demonstrated expertise in conducting psychiatric interviews and analysing large and complex datasets.  Proficiency in at least one statistical software package (e.g. SPSS, Stata, SAS, R, Mplus) is required.

The team is looking for an individual with high calibre to develop studies in the area of digital health in mental disorders, in collaboration with expert researchers and clinicians. The initiative involves the development and evaluation of innovative online mental health detection and intervention tools. The appointee will conduct scholarly research, lead projects, prepare manuscripts and reports, assist in the supervision of junior research staff and students, and perform other duties as assigned. This position would be ideal for someone wanting to develop academically in the field of mental health.  Those who have responded to the previous advertisement (Ref.: 508604) need not re-apply.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.

The University only accepts online applications for the above post.  Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V.    Review of applications will start as soon as possible and continue until February 12, 2022, or until the post is filled, whichever is earlier.

Advertised:Dec 15, 2021 (HK Time)
Applications close:Feb 12, 2022 (HK Time)

有意申請者請 按 APPLY NOW申請

Applications are invited for appointment as Post-doctoral Fellow in the Department of Microbiology (Ref.: 509244), to commence as soon as possible for two years, with the possibility of renewal subject to satisfactory performance.

Applicants should possess a Ph.D. degree or an equivalent qualification in Microbiology or a related discipline. Research experience in performing live virus infection would be an advantage. Applicants should have a good command of written and spoken English, strong communication skills, a strong sense of responsibility, and the ability to work independently. They should also be self-motivated, organized, detail-minded and hardworking. The appointee will be involved in research projects related to emerging viruses, such as coronaviruses, influenza viruses, enteroviruses, and arboviruses under the supervision of Dr. Jasper FW Chan and Dr. Hin Chu.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.

The University only accepts online applications for the above post. Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V.  Review of applications will start as soon as possible and continue until March 31, 2022, or until the post is filled, whichever is earlier.

Advertised:Dec 13, 2021 (HK Time)
Applications close:Mar 31, 2022 (HK Time)

Applications are invited for appointment as Post-doctoral Fellow in the Department of Mechanical Engineering (Ref.: 509144), to commence on or before March 1, 2022 for up to three years.

Applicants should possess a Ph.D. degree in Physics, Electronics, Biomedical Engineering or related disciplines, with a strong background in flexible electronics, lithography patterning, and related areas.  They should have a good command of written and spoken English, be highly self-motivated and able to work independently. Experience in bio-electronics or neural probe fabrications would be a plus. The appointee will work under the supervision of Dr. Paddy K. L. Chan. Enquiries about the duties of the post should be sent to Dr. Paddy K. L. Chan at [via APPLY NOW]

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits. At current rates, salaries tax does not exceed 15% of gross income.

The University only accepts online application for the above post. Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V. Review of applications will start as soon as possible and continue until January 31, 2022, or until the post is filled, whichever is earlier.

Applications are invited for appointment as Post-doctoral Fellow / Senior Research Assistant in the School of Biological Sciences (Ref.: 509195), to commence as soon as possible for two years, with the possibility of renewal.

Applicants should possess a Ph.D. degree with solid hands-on experience in molecular and cellular biology of cancer and animal work. They should have a good command of written and spoken English; a strong sense of responsibility; good organizational skills; and the ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks. Experience in biomechanics, single cell biology or live cell imaging would be an advantage. The appointee will participate in research projects related to cancer cell signaling, tumor immunology, and drug discovery.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.  At current rates, salaries tax does not exceed 15% of gross income.

The University only accepts online application for the above post. Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V. Review of applications will commence as soon as possible and continue until January 15, 2022, or until the post is filled, whichever is earlier.
